boilerroom-desc: Allows wiki users to create boilerplate text in the Boilerplate namespace which can then be used on new pages.
br-create-std-bp-desc: Standard boilerplates are single blocks of text that can be inserted when editing pages. Typically, they are inserted at the cursor, over a selection, at the beginning, at the end, or over all existing text.
br-meta-std-bp:
<openboilerplate>
<!--Optional boilerplate page header-->

<boilerplate>
</openboilerplate>
<boilerplate>

<!--Boilerplate content-->

</boilerplate>
<closeboilerplate>
</boilerplate>

<!--Optional boilerplate page footer-->
</closeboilerplate>
br-create-wrap-bp-desc: Wrapping boilerplates are boilerplates that consist of an opening block that is inserted before the cursor or selection and an closing block inserted afterwards. A third block can be provided to give guidance text when inserted at a cursor rather than a selection. This guidance text is automatically selected to allow it to be easily erased simply by typing.
br-meta-wrap-bp:
<boilerplate>
<!--Optional boilerplate page header-->
<openboilerplate>
<!--Opening boilerplate content: the text to appear before the cursor or selection-->
</openboilerplate>

<boilerplate>
<!--Optional guidance text on content: when this boilerplate is inserted with no text already selected, this text will be selected and easily typed over-->
</boilerplate>

<closeboilerplate>
<!--Closing boilerplate content: the text to appear after the cursor or selection-->
</closeboilerplate>

<!--Optional boilerplate page footer-->

</boilerplate>
br-boilerplate-list-desc: These are the existing boilerplates within the Boilerplate namespace:
br-boilerplate-list-none: These are no existing boilerplates within the Boilerplate namespace.
br-boilerplate-list-note: Any wiki page can potentially be set up as a boilerplate, but any such pages outside the Boilerplate namespace are not listed here.
br-replace-confirm:
Are you sure you want to replace the existing text?

You may not be able to undo this action.
br-page-exists-noajax: Can not load boilerplate on an existing page.
br-page-exists-ajax: Page already exists. Use selector below to load boilerplates.
br-loaded-on-new-page: Text from "$1" loaded on new page.
br-prepend: Text from "$1" inserted at beginning of text.
br-append: Text from "$1" inserted at end of text.
br-replace: Text from "$1" used to replace existing text.
br-no-boilerplates: There are no boilerplates available in the boilerplate namespace. If any are created, they will be available here.
br-tag-error: BoilerRoom error: malformatted tags. Possible causes: There may be a missing closing tag, the opening and closing tags could be on the same line, or content between different boilerplate tags may be overlapping.
apihelp-boilerplate-summary: Allows wiki users to create boilerplate text in the Boilerplate namespace which can then be used on new pages.
